Reviews.Title: “What a find”
Reviews.Author: Derry055
Reviews.Content: Found this hotel by chance when walking down street from minute we entered the reception was warm and friendly we were able to view two rooms and booked straight away. The room was lovely great size at back of hotel room 301. Staff wonderful friendly at all times even booked a restaurant we wanted to visit no problem. Very good location in a local lovely residential area away from tourists. Would recommend and will return

Reviews.Title: “Always again!”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Good Location with sight on Eiffel tower. Free WLAN. Very modern room with a good style. No dust or anything else. Very clean! Nice bathroom. The bed is convenient. Kindly Staff. I would recommend this hotel to everyone. For me more than 3 Stars. But you have to take into consideration that we get the newest and a renovated room. Maybe not every room is like this!

Reviews.Title: “excellent stay and very nice staff”
Reviews.Author: marton53 Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: excellent stay and very nice staff close to restaurants and metro breakfast was very good room was clean and we had a spatious room

Reviews.AuthorLocation: city of brotherly love and high taxes, PA
Reviews.Title: “a great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: vinandtonic
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights here on the recommendation of a co worker who had stayed here on his honeymoon. It's a little off the beaten path but we did not want to stay in the touristy area, plus with the metro it is easy to get around the city. We had a famille room overlooking the courtyard (very quiet) with an extra bed in the entryway, and our bathroom was fairly large too. Our friends had a smaller room with a tiny balcony with a view of the Eiffel Tower. The staff was all very nice and spoke excellent English, which was helpful as my French isn't what it used to be. The room was cleaned extremely well every day. The bed was not that comfortable (rather hard), but as I have back problems it would be fine for someone who doesn't. There is a nice little park a block away, and several restaurants and shops in the area, as well as the Vaugirard metro stop a short distance.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel at a brilliant price!”
Reviews.Author: Mhairi-Claire C
Reviews.Content: When I was looking to book my hotel in Paris I knew I wanted something inexpensive but without compromising service and quality. The hotel was exactly as described and for the price paid it was even better than I expected! The staff were very helpful and spoke English. They were also able to give me helpful directions to the hotel and organise a change of room before I arrived to allow a view of the Eiffel Tower (ask for a balcony). Our room was very clean and the mini bar and condiments were updated daily. My partner and I had no trouble sleeping at night as the double glazed windows kept the noise of the street and road out of our room. The location isn't very central but is extremely close to a supermarket and various restaurants, also with a bakery next door meaning you don't need to go far for necessities. The metro line is very close also, however we never really used it as we would walk to the Eiffel Tower every morning (only 15-20 mins and is quite enjoyable) and use that as our starting base for the day. Breakfast was well worth paying for with plenty of traditional french cheese, meats, bread and croissants which gave us a great start to the day. I would recommend getting down to the breakfast buffet as soon as possible but as one day it did get very busy and began to run out of food, resulting in guests not being able to enjoy the full breakfast. Despite this the hotel was perfect and I do not have any complaints, I will definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Lacks personal touch”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Arrived at hotel at 6pm . Room not made from Previous guests. Next day found old socks at bottom of bed . Total lack of care from cleaners throughout room. We would not return as hotel just felt dirty.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant weekend in a lovely hotel.”
Reviews.Author: PawHouseBoy
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed a wonderful weekend in Paris using this hotel as a base. About 20 - 25 mins from Gare de Nord on the metro with one change. The Vaugirard station is 200 metres away. When you step out of the hotel, you have a wonderful view of the Eiffel tower to the left. The rooms were clean and quite modern with a safe and minibar. There is no bar in the hotel but shops, bars and cafes are close. We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Humble yet high quality hotel”
Reviews.Author: mitchell916
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel in February for a 3 day Valentine’s Day break and was very pleased with my three night stay which I booked via Olohotels. Firstly, the hotel was easy to find, just a couple minutes from the Vaugirard Metro station in the 15th arrondissement of Paris. While slightly away from the city centre the fact you are close to the Metro makes a world of difference as it provides quick and easy access in and out. The hotel itself is located down a quiet road with automatic doors to welcome you in. Check in was effortless and we were taken to our room, a twin bed room which was a decent size for two people although we had to push the bed together! Outside the window on the small balcony there is a decent view of the street and the Eiffel Tower in the distance. In the room you have a flat screen TV with around 30 French channels, kettle with condiments to make tea and coffee, a large wardrobe with safe inside, a desk and a small fridge – all the basic and helpful things you would expect from a 3 star hotel room. The rooms are cleaned daily around midday so once you have come back from a day out expect to find your room spotless with a top up on tea, coffee and biscuits. The bathroom was spacious enough with towels and shampoo, body lotion and shower gel provided. I would recommend anyone booking this hotel to try and get a deal that includes breakfast as it’s certainly worth it. I woke up at 8am to ensure I didn’t miss the breakfast buffet that included pancakes, croissants, cereal, yogurts, toast and a variety of other continental style breakfast treats which saves you spending extra money at a cafe or restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “I loved this place and What a View of the Eiffel tower”
Reviews.Author: Mark B
Reviews.Content: This was a great place to stay and got a great deal on some web site for only 95 euro a night with breakfast. After I booked I called them and asked if I could have the top floor with a balcony to view the Eiffel tower. They took care of my request and that's what I arrived to. Yes the room is very small I had a twin room but aren't most hotels here like that unless you pay big bucks? There were 2 English channels both being news. The beds were comfortable and good internet in the room and a great view. The lobby was like new and modern, the breakfast was just ok. There is an elevator although very small only 2 people can fit in it but sure comes in handy to avoid all the stairs. Location was a 3 min walk to the metro and there's a Indian restaurant down the street where I had the best Indian food ever! We tried the walk one night to the Eiffel tower it took about 1/2 hour very nice walk and felt very safe at all times took the metro back. There's 2 grocery stores by the metro and a Starbucks. The hotel is in district 15. I wouldn't hesitate to stay here again next time especially if I get that same rate.

Reviews.Title: “Really great experience”
Reviews.Author: Priya01
Reviews.Content: I visited this hotel back in August 2011 with my friend but I'm only just getting around to completing the review! Our stay at this hotel was really great. After three train rides from CDG airport and a short walk to the hotel we were met by very friendly reception staff who welcomed us and over the course of the day provided us with maps and travel info as well as directions to the Eiffel Tower (which we made as our starting point every morning when sightseeing-amazing!). I particularly liked the location of the hotel:south of the River Siene/Eiffel Tower (20-30min walk), quiet location with a supermarket and bakery nearby. The metro station was only a few blocks away with a lovely little park where we would sometimes have breakfast. (we didn't eat breakfast inside the hotel so can't comment). The hotel was lovely and clean both outside and inside and our room was great with a fab view of the Eiffel Tower from the balcony (you just have to lean out a bit-but fab none the less!). The bathroom was spacious with a shower and bath and there was a safe inside the room which was very useful as well as a little fridge. The room was cleaned everyday. Yes, the lift is a bit of a squeeze but my friend and I had no problems so long as we didn't move and faced the right way! (Although, it may not be ideal for people in wheelchairs) But Overall, I loved it and had a great time and would definitely come again.

Reviews.Title: “UGH”
Reviews.Author: CapitalHill
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in '09--admittedly a few years ago. The hotel didn't let us know they were under construction, and when we arrived from an overnight flight, they were jackhammering into the wall behind my pillow! The halls were filthy and dusty. What a MESS. The bed was also thin and hard. Also, the hotel is a long walk from the center of town.

Reviews.Title: “My favourite hotel”
Reviews.Author: EvangelosDynou
Reviews.Content: I was for my honeymoon, stayed for 12 nights, and all of them were beautiful.The Balconies have a fantastic view of the tower. the hotel is 2 min walk to the Girard train station. rooms are cosy, clean and supplied every day with tea and towels. the stuff is very very friendly and helpful. the hotel is almsot next to a bakery where you can get your daily frenchy supply of croisants and Baguettes. You will feel like a real Parisian there. Paris is a wonderful city, and so this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: RumGirl24
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I went to Paris in August for our anniversary and stayed in the Hotel Val Girard Monday-Friday. The staff were exceptionally pleasant and always on hand if you had any queries. The rooms were ideal. The hotel was very clean. Our room was on the 4th floor and if we lent out the window, we had a great view of the Eiffel Tower. We had clean towels and a clean bed everyday. The package we had meant that our breakfast was included. We felt there was no real fight for seats because like the rooms, the breakfast area is small, but the breakfast spread was good- Pain au Chocolats were fab! The lift certainly does bring a smile to your face. When we were there they were having their reception renovated, however there was very little disruption. Out with the hotel-The Eiffel Tower is about a 15/20 minute walk from the Hotel. If you are going to the Eiffel Tower at night- you can do as the Parisians do and sit in front of the Tower and drink and eat and watch it sparkle on the Hour from 10pm Would definitely recommend this hotel due to the excellent price and excellent service in the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel in a nice neighborhood!”
Reviews.Author: eladousa
Reviews.Content: We were very happy with our room & stay at Hotel Val Girard. True, the room was very small (NYC style) but who spends that much time in there anyway? Very clean and great view out our window (that opens). Staff was great and helpful and it was in great proximity to a Metro stop.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for!Good value for your money”
Reviews.Author: Newton D
Reviews.Content: Very helpfull and nice staff!!The room was extremely small, but always clean and with a cosy atmosphere.Good breakfast(It worth to pay extra for it)!!!The elevator is a joke(if you going to build one you must build one that can have at least two persons inside)...hehehe.Not a big issue if your room is on the first floor.Location is great and if you are lucky you get a room with a tiny view of the tower.I definitly recommend it for couples in a low budget!!you can get much worse with this money in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Can't beat the view!”
Reviews.Author: M0hans
Reviews.Content: It's a cozy, comfortable and squeaky clean hotel in a clean up market suburb and we thought it's a good value for Paris standard. Our room on the 6th floor had the amazing view of the Eiffel Tower. Every now and then we opened the window to be mesmerized by the " a La tour Eiffel". Every staff of the hotel were very courteous (with fluent English) and happy to be of help. Recomended us to a one of the best bistro in Paris (few meters from the hotel), arranged a luxury car to the Orly airport that was cheaper than the Taxi. Metro,good quality cafes and many other facilities are around this hotel.The room was cozy, comfy, clean with very inviting bed, fluffy white towels and a decent shower. Hmmm...the centraly air-conditioned room also had good supply of coffee, tea, mini bar & flat panel TV with a few English channels. We would certainly recommond this hotel to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: FLB24
Reviews.Content: Hotel Val Girard is a small hotel a little away from the central tourist area. Rooms and facilities are small but adequate. Room was quite clean and the hotel was located in a quiet area. It is well located with about a 20 minute walk to the Eiffel Tower. Rom rates are not exorbitant. The breakfast buffet is not extensive but is a typical Continental breakfast - unfortunately it was not included in the room rate this time. if you prefer there is a pattiserie next door and a number of good restaurants and shops within easy walking distance. The hotel is well positioned with regard to public transport with the metro and buses within easy walking distance and also easy access to the trams connecting to the train to Versailles. The staff is very helpful and spoke good English. This was my second visit to the hotel and I recommend it to my friends. Say hi to Vera. Actually stopped in July 2010 but the site did not have this as an option. Was there on Bastille Day which probably meant the room rate was higher.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent holiday at Val Girard”
Reviews.Author: Allex21
Reviews.Content: I went at Val Girard Hotel with my girlfriend, in august 2011, the staff of the hotel is very polite, they know very good english, and the rooms are awsome, they are comfy and cozy, perfect for a young couple, not expensive at all. The breakfast is a buffet, and it is delicious, you cand have coffee or tea, or both :) and everything that is available for breakfast is fresh. We had a great trip over there, and most probably we will go there again, at least one more time :). Good to know: Sunday, all supermarkets and corner stores from Paris, are closed after 1 or 2 PM. We really love this Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “very pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: Loueze
Reviews.Content: Good location on a quiet street with the metro just a few minutes away. Great walking out the door and having such a fab view of the Eiffel tower. Very clean hotel and the renovations are pretty much finished, so it's all looks like new. The room and ensuite were comfortably furnished and breakfast was plentiful. The staff were friendly and helped with my some directions. The lift was a bit small, but I'd definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great price, location and staff. Exceeded our expectations!”
Reviews.Author: Lou K
Reviews.Content: The hotel was in a great location and quite area, with a metro just up the road. Metro was surprisingly easy to use and safe! We were on the top floor, the room was lovely with a very comfy bed and a safe in the wardrobe. It was also equipped with air-con and an large en-suite and we never had a problem with hot or cold water or any weird smells. There was a kettle and mini bar in the room. Towels and sheets were changed everyday. We were greeted with a smile and all the staff there were always ready to help us as well as very kind. The breakfast included in the price was great and you can eat as much as you need to. It was a little buffet bar style with breads, ham, cheese, yoghurts, cereal and lots of croissants, orange juice tea etc. perfect to start the day to. There are lots of restaurants near by, but the main streets always tend to me more expensive the first night came to €55 for two of us. we tried to keep of these roads and head down smaller streets to more local places. the only difficulty we had was that we had to hold the shower head when showering as the placement of the bracket caused the water to spill out. Overall we had a perfect stay for a great price! and our first trip to Paris was made unforgettable, we would definitely recommend this hotel to friends and family :)

Reviews.Title: “Extensive renovations going off at present”
Reviews.Author: SmithsStapleford
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights, first impressions were not good, greeted by workmen, and dust everywhere, we were aware of some renovation work going on from reviews on here,since early spring i believe,but i have to say the ammount of work that was going off the hotel should have been shut. The staff were all very friendly and spoke quite good english, the temporary reception area is just a mess quite honestly.We asked for a balcony room on the 5th floor,503, believing it to be a better room, it was unbelievably small,i kept walking in to the chair/ desk area to get around the bed.However for such a tiny room, it did have all the essentials,and good a/c.Also we had wine in our room as it was our anniversary.I was quite looking forward to having breakfast in the lovely area shown on the website with the courtyard garden,no,it was shut,we were put in a small room next to reception complete with dust.There were approx 5 tables in there,so was manic at breakfast time.You have to hand your key in everytime you go out.One night the man at reception gave us a key for the room next door !! we didnt realise until we had climbed 5 flights of stairs,(lift was too claustrophobic for my liking)but it was a good job we are honest. The area itself is lovely, lots of good restaurants/bars/shops,its a good 30 minute walk to the tower,we did time it. Definately recommend the Batobus (boat) 14 euros each for a day ticket,you just hop on/off its great.The queues to go up the tower looked about 4 hours long,even at night. All in all we really enjoyed our short break, and i think the hotel will be lovely when its finished,contemporary looking,i do think it would be nice to be pre-warned about the state the hotel is in before you arrive,or be offered a discount as it is not good value in its present state.

Reviews.Title: “We loved this place.”
Reviews.Author: momcolin
Reviews.Content: This hotel was in a quiet neighborhood with many very nice restaurants close by and a great bakery next door.. The elevator was small but room for a full size bag and one person. Breakfast was included and represented a very nice European breakfast. What I liked best is you were a block from the metro, but away from all the big tourist hotels. Rooms were smaller than American hotels but very charming. The staff set up our return trip to airport and the fee they took was applied to our fair.The fair was less than the amount British Airways charged for transportation. The staff spoke English and went out of their way to be helpful. They were so patient and answered so many questions.I would recommed this hotel if you really want to experience Paris without falling over other American Tourists.

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely stay here again!!”
Reviews.Author: Shazhudson
Reviews.Content: I visited Paris, with my Mum and Niece, in July 2011 and stayed at Val Girard hotel for 3 nights with breakfast included in a super rate we found on the internet. I had emailled the hotel, in advance, just to check that we would have renovated rooms in a quiet area of the hotel and I had an extremely speedy reply, they came up trumps too!!!! The hotel is not right in the middle of Paris but this is nice as you get away from the 'madness' of the city so can relax a bit more. The reception area was being decorated while we stayed but this did not bother us at all. I had a room on the 5th floor with a lovely little balcony from which I could see the Eiffel Tower so could enjoy watching it twinkling later at night. My Mum and niece shared a twin room on the 4th floor, while they did not have a balcony, they had a railing which they could peer over at the Eiffel Tower and were perfectly happy. Both rooms were renovated and spotlessly clean with everything you need...good TV in a good position (although you don't come to Paris to watch TV but nice when getting ready or chilling before sleep), mini bar, safe in the wardrobe, tea/coffee making facilities (a rarity!), hairdryer and nice toiletries with a really good shower. The air conditioning worked brilliantly too which was a godsend as it was a pretty clammy 3 nights. The breakfast was perfectly fine..croissants, pastries, bread, cheese, ham, cereals, yoghurt, fruit, etc...set us up very nicely for a day of sightseeing. We ordered breakfast, in the room, on the final day so we could take our time getting ready to depart the hotel...this was delivered with no problems whatsoever. The lady who does the breakfast and cleans rooms was so lovely and friendly and always had a smile on her face. In fact, all of the staff were very good and helpful and very welcoming when coming in at any time. As mentioned in other reviews, the lift is very small...the smallest I've ever been in but it works just fine!! We rather liked the area that the hotel was situated in...we ate round there every night. We had a particularly lovely meal in L'Avergne (I think!!)...which is just down the bottom of the road of the hotel and across the road there...super service and wonderful grub at a very reasonable price and the waiter went out of his way to change things on the menu to suit my fussy niece!! We ate in another couple of not so good restaurants but they were ok for the money. We only used a Carnet each of metro tickets and this was getting from Gard Du Nord to Vaugirard as well when arriving. We decided to take a taxi back for the Eurostar as we were all a bit too tired to use the metro...it only cost 22 euros which we thought was great value as it's quite a decent journey. Note: if you go to visit the Sacre Coeur and get off at Absesses metro, make sure you take the lift as the stairs go on forever...we made the mistake and I nearly had an asthma attack!! This was my 4th visit to this fabulous city and won't be my last...I would most definitely consider staying at Val Girard hotel again as it's the best hotel I've stayed in, in Paris, by far and I've done 4 stars too. Lovely hotel, staff, breakfast, rooms, area and great sleep...don't miss out!!!! Thanks so much to all at the hotel Val Girard....hope to see you all soon!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful French Boutique Style Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Simkat5566
Reviews.Content: The hotel is set about 400 yards from Vaugirard metro station. The hotel was under refurbishment in the reception area during our visit, but this did not cause any issues during our stay. The hotel was clean, pleasant and the staff were friendly and helpful. The hotel is also set out of the tourist 'zone' so the bars and cafes near the hotel felt local rather than 'touristy'. If you are using the metro to get around Paris it's well worth buying tickets in bulk. We paid 25 Euros for 20 tickets, which covered our travel around Paris for three days. The only downside we found is that the lift is very very small. It will carry literally only two bags and one person. Other than that I enjoyed my stay and would visit Paris again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely little hotel”
Reviews.Author: Amanda186302
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 4 day break to celebrate our 10th wedding anniversary. The hotel is lovely, in a very nice area and with the Metro literally 3 minutes walk up the street. The hotel isn't fancy and the staff are not overly gushing, but they are polite enough and despite the hotel being renovated during our stay it didn't interfere with our enjoyment at all. The High Speed Wifi is just that, and completely free for as many devices as you need. During the whole break we found Parisiens to be very friendly, not at all aloof as we expected and we felt safe both walking the city and riding the Metro late at night. You can see the Eiffel Tower from the front bedrooms (you do have to peer left up the street, but it is visible). Don't make the mistake we did of trying to walk to the Eiffel Tower thinking it was just up the road. It's so huge you can see it from all over the city and as you walk it seems to get further and further away! It is within walking distance of the hotel but only in comfortable shoes, and probably not in heels after a romantic meal and a few drinks as I tried to do! We found attractions and the Metro reasonably priced, but sit-down meals cost a fortune. I suggest you try to get takeaway baguettes or sandwiches for your lunch as lunch in a cafe will easily set you back £40. Save your pennies for dinner. Over the road from the hotel are some gardens and the City Hall, and a lovely restaurant called Le Cap. This was full of locals when we visited and if you say that the hotel recommended the restaurant they will give you complementary drinks. Another great restaurant was just down the street called Le Petel. Very authentic French food which was divine. There is a creperie up the road near the Metro station which was handy for a snack on our return late at night from the latin quarter! All round a great trip, would love to live in the South East so I could just hop on the Eurostar and visit more often! Just one hint. Do check whether your room includes breakfast because we believed ours did and were presented with a bill for 75 Euros as we checked out.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect base for our Paris honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: KEVandTRACEY
Reviews.Content: We stayed at val Girard for our honeymoon and can say that the hotel was lovely, The staff were very friendly and extremley helpful and all spoke good English. They can organise trips and excursions for you if you wish, can recomend the bus tour excellent value for money. Breakfast is the typical continental style buffet and it very nice indeed. About 40 mins walk to the effiel tower, but the metro station is only 2 mins away and can take you anywhere in minutes. If you dont want to travel into the centre there are plenty of bars, bistros and restaurants just around the corner from the hotel on rue vaugirard. The hotel room was comfortable, clean and spacious enough for two with a decent on-suite. The hotel was having some decorating work done whilst we were there but this didnt spoil our stay, and by the looks off things it will be lovely when completed. All in all if we ever go back to Paris we wont hesitate to book val girard again. (word of advice, bars prices are through the roof dont be surprised to be paying £5 per glass of wine and upto £8 for a pint) ALL IN ALL BRILLIANT TIME, WONDERFUL CITY, GREAT HOTEL

Reviews.Title: “very good value for money”
Reviews.Author: AndreeaHerzog
Reviews.Content: the check in is @14.00, so schedule your arrival around this hour. small but very nice cozy,and clean rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely loved it!”
Reviews.Author: losfanfanos
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel! Rooms large, modern and very comfy :) walking distance to Eifel tower. Absolutely loved it!

Reviews.Title: “I loved Hotel Val Girard, I loved Paris, and I will be back!”
Reviews.Author: Suehayzer
Reviews.Content: The hotel was intimate and friendly, and despite decorating going on in the stairway - for which they were very apologetic - the break was lovely. A good location, the Eifel Tower could be seen from our window, very quiet area and a few good restaurants to be found locally. Nearby there is a garden square with a band stand and places to sit. The buses and the Metro are close by. Local supermarkets for stocking up with water etc. The breakfast was better than expected from other reviews, there was a choice of cheese, cold meats, jams, croissants, rolls, bread, eggs, yoghurt, fruit, pain au chocolat, various teas, coffee and hot chocolate. The lift was very small and caused us much amusement! We visited just before Easter and there were Easter eggs on the reception. In a previous review someone cautioned about a room behind the reception, but I think this must have changed as I couldn't see a roon behind reception. Overall a super hotel, we will definitely be back one day.

Reviews.Title: “close to all amenities”
Reviews.Author: andrea12303
Reviews.Content: hotel val girard is in a great location, close to metro, restaurants, shops and eiffel tower. ideal for those who spend most of the time out of the hotel. breakfast was more than enough, very friendly staff and understood english well. tv channels are all in french though, except for two news channels. would surely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: branelukac
Reviews.Content: Small and clean hotel on excellent location. Renovation in progress in April 2011. We have renovated room, clean and quite. Equiped with safe, fridge, coffee / tea and kettle. Bathroom and WC separated. Charming welcome pack, red wine and candies. But no corkscrew - used my on pocketknife. Experienced travelers have it. Instead booked triple room, get superior double with extra bed. Hotel manager miss Vera was very polite, with excuse offered free breakfast for days in this room as compensation. Fair deal. All staff was very helpful. Bicycle station, metro and bus stations very near. Easy to reach all Paris landmarks. Carefour supermarket and various shops very near.

Reviews.Title: “Gross Experience AND No A/C”
Reviews.Author: escobar561
Reviews.Content: The main issue was with the housekeeping services. Since the bathroom had nowhere to hang our towels to dry, we had to put them on the floor and get new ones. Unfortunately, housekeeping would always put at least one towel on the bidet--which is the equivalent to putting it on rim of the toilet! The worst part of the whole experience was this: My mom was sick and had a runny nose at night on her pillow, which left a pretty nasty stain. The next day, she put the pillowcase on the floor as a signal that it needed to be changed. Housekeeping picked the pillowcase off the floor and put it right back on the pillow!!!! With the same exact stain!!! Believe me, it was gross enough as is, but the fact that housekeeping chose it pick it up off the floor and put it right back on was the final straw--hence, the 1 star rating. They would also neglect to replace our used beverage glasses, until we put them on the floor next to the garbage can. We were pleased upon arrival to the hotel--the receptionists was very friendly and the reception area was modern. We were pretty content until we realized that the air conditioner was not functioning since the hotel turns it off during the cool months. The hotel staff couldn't even tell us when it was supposed to get turned on, and the manager that had the capability to resolve the issue was on holiday. Unfortunately, our nights were uncomfortably warm.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: CameronD17
Reviews.Content: I took my girlfriend to this hotel on our anniversary after reading some good reviews about the hotel, all of which turned out to be true. The hotel is in a great location in the city, with a metro station within two minutes walk, and the Eiffel tower within about 10-15 minutes walk. The view from our room was okay, you could see the Eiffel Tower (just, and if you leaned out of the window), but the Parisian architecture was still pleasant to look at. We booked an upgraded room, the only apparent difference being that it had a bath instead of a shower stall, although the room was still a fair size with the bigger bathroom. We did not take the extra option of breakfast; aside from the fact there was a bakery down the road for much cheaper, as another reviewer pointed out, we had planned on late nights and late mornings, so we wouldn't have been up in time anyway. The room was always cleaned and beds made up every night, and soaps etc. replaced. We only stayed for three nights, but the sheets were stil changed at least once, which I wasn't really expecting. The staff all seemed very nice, and helped us in any way they could, from directions and advice to telling us when our taxi arrived. The only (slight) negative is the comically-small lift; the two of us had to stack ourselves and our cases like Tetris blockst to get to the room, although this was only a minor inconvenience. Overall, I would definitely recommend this hotel for a couple or a romantic break.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel- totally perfect location”
Reviews.Author: suzyq18
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights in September . It was the perfect base in Paris and incredibly reasonably priced. Fantastic staff made us very welcome, and although the rooms are small they are immaculatly presented , lets face it if you are in paris , you should not be spending much time in it anyway. It is within walking distance of the effiel tower ( about 25 mins) which we also had of view of if you leaned out of the window !!!Being within 3 mins walk of the underground makes everything very accessible and the day out in disney was no trouble ! Overall this is a fantastic base to make the most out of a fantastic city .

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING HOTEL-FAB LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: kirsty-adele
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from the val girard last night. Hotel was fabulous... very modern and trendy, tea/coffee making facilities inc, fresh towels, safe, very comfy beds aswell! we had a balcony room with a fab view of the eiffel tower which was perfect. Travelled as a suprise present for my sisters 21st birthday. Staff at reception were very welcoming and friendly, and gave us information on how to get to other places when asked, as we had already booked to go and stay at disneyland paris for a few days also. Breakfast was very nice, typical continental breakfast with fruit juices, hot chocolate, tea and coffee available. Brill location, plenty of restaurants around etc. To make things easier i would suggest getting a taxi from vau girard station to the hotel as you wudnt have a clue where you were going, only costs 6 euros! We walked almost everywhere... you can see the eiffel tower from the hotel, just walk town to the bottom of the road and follow it, you will get there, was a nice walk to get to it, with restaurants shops etc along the way. The eiffel tower is a must, was fantastic to go to the very top! just 13.10 euros. Try being there when it goes a little darker, its amazing. I would also reccomend getting on the bateaux bus (boat along the seine, you can hop on and hop off when you want an takes you to the famous attractions... eiffel tower, louvre, notre dame etc etc ) an this was just 13 euros also. Lots of nice restaurants, aswell as subway, mcdonalds etc. I particulary didnt find Paris expensive as others do... drinks like tea/ hot chocolate etc are the most expensive, your looking at 5 euros. Lots of shops around, and transport is very frequent! Very nice place to visit and will be returning very soon! If you fancy going to disney for a day trip, its only 90 mins on the train away and well worth a visit!

Reviews.Title: “The hotel staff are great!”
Reviews.Author: nanceb4019
Reviews.Content: We stayed for four nights at the Hotel Val Girard! The staff are really great, the rooms are very clearn, the breakfast is really nice and the location is close to Metro! What more could you ask for!

Reviews.Title: “Never Ever book this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Hotelscreener2010
Reviews.Content: We arrived and paid 160 euro's a night. We got room 003 just opposite the reception. This room was not worth a penny. Very small, dirty, very hot, no airco which was booked. Eventhough they were not ashamed to give us this room looks like it came out of the 50's. When we left, we still had to pay the 160 euro for that room. They also freezed money from my creditcard, which was not back after a few days, even though they said it was just a pre-authorisation. When back at home, I had to move heaven and earth to get back my money. Very sneaky people there.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect place to stay in Paris!”
Reviews.Author: NaladaOxford
Reviews.Content: We went as a group of friends and were very pleased with the overall location, service and charm. Anne who greeted us was a perfect hostess and showed us how to best get around Paris. The family room was spacious with great air conditioning. The bathroom was large with a fantastic shower with large shower head. Breakfast was splendid with a great selection of continental foods, including lots of fresh fruit. The hotel staff were superb and made us feel very welcome. All in all a great place to stay in Paris and very reasonably priced considering the location and standard which is of a high calibre. Thank you!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Staff....small rooms”
Reviews.Author: Subhro
Reviews.Content: From the hotel room you can see the Eiffel Tower.Cozy room but you may feel little small.Lift is too small.But the staffs are the best part of this hotel.They are really co-ordinal and helpful.I was staying here for my marriage anniversary and on the day of marriage anniversary surprisingly we found Champaign in our room! They were very helpful and informative.All over a nice and peaceful stay in a totally unknown city!

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING !! SO HAPPY WITH THE CHOICE !!”
Reviews.Author: iloveit46
Reviews.Content: I searched for hotels in Paris for weeks... I kept coming back to Hotel Val Girard so I decided to book it. I have to say that I am so thrilled that I did. Hotel was in great location, beautiful view of eiffel tower, staff was so friendly, spoke english very well, room was always cold with wonderful AC, and trust me in Paris AC is like heaven. The hotel made my stay in Paris so much better ! I friend stayed at a hotel down the street that was twice as much per night and she was so jealous of my room. We both will for sure be staying here when we come again. Thank You so much !!

Reviews.Title: “A very cozy hotel”
Reviews.Author: Pepone_10
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very comfortable, I mean: silent, clean, good bed, very helpful employees. It isn't very big, but we asked for the standard one, so it was expected yet. I liked the care of windows with "against pigeons" sticks outside, and they are all over the city... The location isn't at the turistic center, which was a very good thing. The familiar neighborhood, with subway, restaurants, supermarket, bakery, pharmacy, wine bar, pretty little square, all in 1 or 2 squares walking from hotel, made everything easier, when we returned from the long days. And they can reserve tickets for spectacles and a good and cheap van service to airport. Unique suggestion: more entertaining channels in english at TV, they have just BBC and CNN.

Reviews.Title: “Very good!”
Reviews.Author: dmed
Reviews.Content: Not many bad things about this hotel. Room is extremely clean, good size and surprizingly huge beautiful bathroom! Located near a major street and a subway station, getting around isn't a problem. A view of the Eiffel tower is also possible which is nice, just don't expect the close-up or romantic one! Service is great, front desk was extremely helpful and nice. Breakfast is elaborate and you can have it in a nice garden type table if it's not too cold. A lil pricey, but I really have nothing bad to say about this hotel....only the tiny elevator, bt it's actually more a funny remark than a complaint.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel”
Reviews.Author: lindychrsmith
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Hotel Val Girard for a week. I had a Confort room, which was an adequate size with a nice sized bathroom. It was clean and tidy with a flat screen t.v. and an electronic safe. The bath had tile throughout ( a couple of tiles were missing, though) and nice modern fixtures. The room was cleaned daily, though they clearly did not change the sheets every day, perhaps not for the entire week. The bed/mattress seemed to retain alot of heat so we woke up sweating at night even when the room was cool. We had room 2 on the bottom floor, which was close to the kitchen and could hear banging from food preparation in the morning. The staff was very courteous at all times and all of them spoke English. For some strange security reason, they had us leave our keys at the front desk every time we left. When returning, we had to ask for the key. After returning from touring, I asked for the key and was given it without question from staff I hadn't met before. The metro was a short two blocks south. It is a slightly long walk to Eiffel Tower, so we took the metro each day to tourist attractions. Be sure to go to Le Quartier du Pain bakery and buy some chouchettes! Walk two blocks south, turn right, and it's the second or third shop. (Note: you'll be passing by two other bakeries on the way with some good selections also.) Another couple of shops past Le Quartier du Pain is a grocery store, and there are several shops and cafes in each direction. All in all, I enjoyed my stay and felt comfortable there. I'd recommend it if you find a good deal, but this is the only place I've stayed at in Paris and have no good standard of comparison for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Small hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: jodidesign2
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just got back from our honeymoon, and I picked this hotel based on reviews from this very website... The staff was very friendly (it helps if you know French), very helpful, and they gave us a great recommendation for dinner one night (Le Cap, very close to the hotel)... The room was small but nice - the bathroom had not been updated but was functional and served our needs... The hairdryer is old, yes, but worked nonetheless... We loved having a view of the Eiffel Tower outside our window and never had an issues w/noise even though our room was facing the street (4th floor)... We did not eat at the hotel since there were several patisseries and cafes close by... I highly recommend this hotel if you're looking to stay in Paris - the metro is 3 blocks away and there's plenty to see and do right in the neighborhood... Would stay here again! =)

Reviews.Title: “Lovely French Hotel”
Reviews.Author: KTroxall
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Val Girard is a great little hotel in the 15th arrondissement. It has picturesque view of the Eiffel Tower as soon as you step out the front door. Tres, tres charming! The standard rooms are quaint (certainly much bigger than any New York boutique hotel's rooms) with separate bathrooms and toilet rooms. They serve a simple, but effective, breakfast every morning to get you going before sight-seeing. If you prefer pastries, baguettes, or a little something extra, there are three delicious french patisseries within steps of the hotel. My partner and I found ourselves there every day for an eclair or some of their mouthwatering loaves of french bread. And though we discovered that we were spending more time in the Marais or other neighborhoods on the Right Bank, there is a Metro station within a three minute walk to get you all over the city. The hotel's staff is welcoming and eager to assist with any needs. They were able to recommend great restaurants, share insider tips, and call shops and cafes for us with our questions. It's a small, but powerful, operation.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Service Despite Volcanic Ash!!”
Reviews.Author: TeamHydro
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in Paris many times and in some overly expensive and poorly kept hotels, however on this occasion I was organising a suprise honeymoon for my sister. I contacted the manager Anne and she organised everything for us ensuring the happy couple got a room with a balcony with a view of the eiffel tower and a bottle of champagne chilled for arrival. Anne's service was exceptional...friendly and personal which is rare in busy city hotels, when volcanic ash caused the initial flight to be cancelled Anne moved the stay without charge or fuss. Although I did not stay my sister indicated that the staff were friendly and helpfull, the room was spacious and well appointed and spotless and breakfast service was efficient. In terms of customer service and reservation ease I would highly recomend this hotel, Anne and her team.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect place to relax after long sightseeing”
Reviews.Author: bartekel
Reviews.Content: We booked the hotel with travel agency after a long hesitation. Finally we came to a decision and chose this hotel. We arrived around 7 pm from Orly airport and were welcomed by the receptionist who started speaking to us in fluent English. We got a standard double room on the second floor which was clean, of average size with tv, phone, mini-bar, air-condition and with the view on the Eiffel Tower. The bathroom was clean with towels changed everyday. We also had breakfasts which was great. You get plenty to choose from: cereals, baguette, 3 types of deli meat, 3 types of cheese, fruit salad, pastries, yoghurt and of course coffee, tea and juice (3 types again). The staff was very kind, ready to help; however only 2 out of 4 people we met spoke English. The cleaning ladies were almost invisible for the guests but after a whole day of walking we were sure the room had been perfectly cleaned. The area where the hotel is situated is really great and safe. From the Vaugirad metro station towards the hotel there are 2 supermarkets, a bakery and a brasserie. The walk from the station to the hotel takes you 2-3 minutes and while approaching the hotel you can admire the Eiffel Tower :) This year we're coming back to Paris and definitely this hotel is on our A-list.

Reviews.Title: “Super Hotel”
Reviews.Author: stupandus
Reviews.Content: We have just spent 3 enjoyable nights at this hotel.And found it to be very clean and comfortable.The staff are all very polite and helpful. It is situated in a quiet residential area,close to metro and shops etc
